title: 106_s2827
content: The conveyance of Ft. Lyon Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center in Colorado to the State of Colorado is discussed in Section 1. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may convey a 512-acre parcel of real property in Colorado to the State for use as a correctional facility, with the condition that public access to Kit Carson Chapel and the cemetery is maintained. The State of Colorado can relocate Kit Carson Chapel to Fort Lyon National Cemetery or another chosen location. The Secretary must open three health care facilities and a nursing home care facility in VISN 19 before the conveyance is made. Environmental restoration activities must also be completed before the conveyance. The Secretary may convey personal property to the State of Colorado without consideration if not needed for Department of Veterans Affairs facilities in southern Colorado or Ft. Lyon National Cemetery. A survey will determine the exact acreage and legal description of the property to be conveyed. The Secretary may require additional terms and conditions for conveyances to protect US interests. Costs for activities under this subsection will be covered by the State of Colorado. The closure of Ft. Lyon Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center may impact the administration of health care for veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may pay for nursing home care for veterans relocated from Ft. Lyon Medical Center in Colorado. The Act does not affect staffing requirements for extended care services. Additionally, voluntary early retirement authority is extended. Extension of Voluntary Early Retirement Authority for Ft. Lyon Department of Veterans Affairs Medical Center employees until June 30, 2001. Under Secretary for Health to report on Veterans Health Care in Southern Colorado within one year of any authorized conveyance. The VISN 19 must report to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs about the status of the health care system for veterans in Southern Colorado, including any improvements made during a specific period.
